HKsAFo6vODvsNSGLsAGTLg.text: My friend and I walked into English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop two very hungry girls and left two very happy girls. The place was full and we didn't have a reservation but they were so kind and found us a table! The food and tea was delicious - especially the bacon ;) - and the exceptional service made eating here a great experience: Lucy, Fatimah, and Shelby are absolute GEMS. They were so friendly and funny, making our breakfast so so enjoyable! Great food, and even greater service - would definitely recommend.

DIiT6FQpHqH6VF451j866w.text: It's not very clean. My tea cup got some stains on it. And I had a cherry tomato tastes like fish... Afternoon tea is not amazing...

F7rYJBMdj-C_wReyybpbTg.text: This was a charming little establishment. My brother, friend and I came here after visiting Buckingham Palace. The place is a short walk with a really nice afternoon tea service. The scones were yummy and I really enjoyed it. The tea selection was pretty varied for such a small spot. I enjoyed every bit and highly recommend over the super pricey hotel teas. The staff was also friendly and personable. Loved it all.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

vjCzXg3tlfhiPo_wUu5SoQ.text: Very cute tea house next to Buckingham Palace.  They serve all types of paninis and breakfast items.  I wanted to try the afternoon tea, but didn't get a chance.  I saw some of the pictures and it looks like a fun time for the family, especially for the kids.  I'm still not sure what "British" food is, but this was a good start.

bg8CwMdort68NPG7o9ICAg.text: Breakfast and coffe was ok for me so I would give it a 3 but my wife and daughter liked the scones and clotted cream and jam, and their tea was really good so she guilted me into giving it a 4

uZhqi9He277G9-JAGaHbsA.text: We loved our meal at Cafe Bella, food was really good and service was great.  We had breakfast here on a Tuesday morning, nice crowd.  Super cute surroundings

W0XWuMGtetwTXTGN3d6VpA.text: Came here with my mother while on vacation in London.  It has a wonderful atmosphere.  I adore the "shabby chic" decor.  I had the brie and cranberry panini and my mother had a jacket potato.  Both hit the spot.  Victoria sponge and a cup of tea for dessert. Really enjoyed my experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

8REcBEio3GYigB0Cl3TKpA.text: Absolutely adorable! So close to Victoria station so a great alternative to the same old train station fare for a place to kill time...

9rVyqoSt7eaawyNQS05E1Q.text: Cosy and quaint.  Comforting, home-made food.  Pleasant staff.  Great location.  It's right behind Buckingham Palace.

ekKOMjUCy_cudE5px2vPNg.text: This is a review for Cafe Bella Maria's wonderful service, cozy-unique decor, and mouthwatering cream tea!After a very stressful morning, my group of 7/8 classmates and I (studying abroad from Los Angeles) took a break from our touristy adventures at this cafe. We came in for the free wifi and shade. The antique looking tea cups immediately caught my eye. I definitely didn't expect to be so impressed with their food and service.4 girls split the afternoon tea for two, and the waitress was nice enough to give us 4 teas :) (She could probably see how thirsty and tired we were from lugging around all our bags). That really resonated with me, and I appreciate it a lot. (Thank you!!)The set came out with 2 large scones, jam, LIFE-CHANGING SWEET CREAM, 2 cakes, and 2 sandwiches. Unfortunately, the chocolatey fudge cake was dry and unimpressive. The meat sandwiches were also forgettable.However, the scones were enough to redeem everything. Warm, buttery (but not overwhelming), light, and...sconey. My mom's signature dessert is her blueberry scone, and right when I bit into Cafe Bella Maria's, I blurted out that these were the best scones I've ever had. Their sweet cream is also whipped so that it's super airy when you spread it. But what makes their cream tea unique is how perfectly the cream pairs with the fruit jam. It's not too sweet, so that you can really taste the milky-creaminess (which I love, since I love whipped cream). The jam tops it off with the fruity flavor I love on a scone. I've also tried the scones at Mock Turtle and Blackbird in Brighton, as well as Ambassadors Bloomsbury in London. They can't even compare!I've been dreaming about their delicious scones, cream, and jam since. I will be returning this weekend and bringing my friends from Scotland to try them as well. Can't wait!

GBZrW5qjQxj95Y-pupFt6A.text: Cafe Bella Maria is where I had my first real English breakfast, and I was wholly satisfied (though the beans were not my thing). The eggs and toast were great, and the mushrooms were a standout. I also had a homemade scone with clotted cream and jam - so good - and a latte. The dining area is adorably decorated and they sell small tea-themed gifts in the front. Even if you're not hungry, grab a latte to go on your way to Buckingham palace!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast and homemade scone
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. The lattes are great!
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Cute decorations and teapot tower

j9GsgVbYti0whPkH8W8d1g.text: Very cute little coffee shop located down the street from Buckingham Palace. Staff are very friendly. Very cute decorations throughout. Seems like walking into someone country home with the mismatch furniture & little jars of jam and teapots. We needed somewhere to grab a bite to eat to fuel up for our day of sightseeing.  The restaurant is not very large but cozy. Staff was friendly & attentive to our needs. Love finding these little gems during our travels.

RBz29PgaGS45UZTFo4yeJw.text: Cute little cafe! Great service and very pleasant staff. I got the full English breakfast and it's a lot to start off your day. Definitely would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

EDE-a9q57Fgknsku_8XSaA.text: I was just wandering around Buckingham Palace before a tour and came across this cute little cafe. Had an English breakfast and an Americano. Everything was wonderful and the service was quick! I would come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

rU4R3d_GWMiLQpOvSGfi-w.text: This is a perfect place for a quick but delicious English breakfast. Cozy snd charming, great service with a nice variety of good choices. They even sell an assortment of umbrellas which I laughed off the first time I saw them. Today I'm taking one with me as it's pouring outside.

yCt1LJ9HQGS2yqe0aHbzeQ.text: Cosy lovely tea house with accessible prices! Good location (very close to Victoria station, and walking distance from Hyde Park), friendly staff.

C2ThOeODp26DyBpds2fbiA.text: I went here a couple times when I was in London a few months ago. The most perfect cafe for a cheap bite & yummy pot of tea. Whenever I'm back in town I'll definitely head back here :3

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. *take me back*
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Cozy tea pot. How could you not love this?
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Clotted cream & scone. It was so tasty and light

xQ44awDn0PZJbUsChq_IXA.text: Cute little cafe, had pot of herbal tea and TWO scones.  Warm, fresh, yummy scones fully loaded with jam and clotted cream.  Cosy setting.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Scone halves
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Pot of tea and scone

LtfyJaVO63Na6RVnvMl6_A.text: Went there on a Sunday morning just after it opened. 10:00. Very comfortable feel and a warm welcome from the staff. L. had a roast vegetable and mozzarella omelet and caramel coffee. I had cappuccino and the full farmer's breakfast. 18:20 GBP sans tip. Perfect start to a long day of walking on a sunny Spring day.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

sm7Om3WXVFjlCoQP3r-FnA.text: Charming little cafe with good food. The minestrone soup is the best I've had. They are located just around the corner from Bag of Nails Irish pub down the road just a bit from The Royal Mews.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

20x5jAgXdByeyiiSYtdjKQ.text: Very cute and friendly place. We would come back here anytime! Very good value for low prices.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Eggs & Bacon
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Tea for two.

x1pzBXnuDUPVlu8nnudRXg.text: Excellent service. Great location. Very cozy place with a nice but small selection of food and sweets. And everything was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Caprese baguette
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Chicken salad

5Q7BDxPkv5M8p7kh_hQ__A.text: After spending the morning wandering around Buckingham Palace we were famished and tried to find a spot for some breakfast. After passing up probably 5 other restaurants we happened upon Bella Maria. There was a table empty outside, so we opted for that.Service was very slow, but friendly. It took quite a long time to place our orders, get our coffees and food, and get the bill. For breakfast, I had a caramel latte and English breakfast minus mushrooms. The English breakfast was good, but a little cold, which made me wonder if it was sitting around for a bit before our server picked it up.Cute little spot that seems to draw locals and tourists alike.

XZlcMZKvHMMtofrumBBhpw.text: Place is closed and undergoing construction. I took an Uber here this morning and was very upset to see that it's not even on business right now. :/

T1OXNkfKS-dt-Qi2PEPorg.text: Loved this place! Everything is super cute and homemade! Food and dessert was delicious, and most importantly was not overly priced. I recommend if you're looking for something not too expensive with great tea and coffee.

PCIQB1vNqLIhD-nftctsSg.text: Delicious breakfast! The kids loved the porridge with Nutella. I had the yogurt with granola and honey and my husband had the mediterranean eggs. All so good! Coffee was nice and strong and the freshly squeezed orange juice was very good. Oh any my son loved his hit chocolate with cream and marshmallows. Great service as well!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

lscOF4SbFzBemwMM2IwWUQ.text: Great spot to eat light breakfast or lunch right by Buckingham Palace. Their Americano iced coffee was great and the croissant with ham and cheese was amazing, everything tastes fresh. The cafe itself is very cute with lots of things you can purchase. Great staff and prices are super affordable especially for being in a tourist area. We came back twice!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Little powder room by the bathroom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Cute display of tea pots that are also for sale

D08mnkawx0xYAQHeTMiR0A.text: My family and I came here at around 3:00 for afternoon tea and it was AMAZING!! All of us loved it. The scones are to die for, the ginger sandwiches are delicious, and the cakes and muffins are amazing as well. The staff was extremely kind, so the service was amazing too!! Overall, a complete 10/10. D

sL90a1CMHj18DUCScWUjHg.text: Nothing says weekend in London like enjoying an afternoon cup of tea after exploring the city. Recently, I had the opportunity to visit England with a group of fellow study abroad students. After a morning of maneuvering the many tube lines and trying to see all of the sights of the city, we all found ourselves ready for some caffeine and a snack. After seeing Buckingham Palace, we decided to get coffee at the next place we saw, which lucky for us, was the adorable Cafe Bella Maria. The ascetic of the cafe was charming between its displays of brightly painted tea pots and miniature jars of homemade jam. After the epic choice of deciding between coffee or tea, I found myself ordering a delicious latte and traditional English scone. The scone was one of the best I have had in Europe and I liked my coffee a latte. All of my travel companions were also satisfied with their orders providing raving reviews of the croissants, crumpets, and teas. We left having spent only a few pounds each making the experience even better! Stopping in a teahouse or cafe is a must when in Britain, and Cafe Bella Maria is the perfect spot to do so!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

6T5ZtVbMuMuGtvRQWmvHHw.text: We did the tea for 2 and it was delicious! The scones and tea. It was also affordable compare to other tea places. We ordered baguettes and it was tasty and filling. Cute little place for afternoon tea! :)

_WmLdRmnTfMBRzfD86Pi6g.text: Had a delightful breakfast before walking around Buckingham palace! The shop is adorable and homey, very friendly staff, and the food was wonderful. Had a tomato, pesto, and mozzerella baguette and my partner had a ham croissant....both very tasty! And of course had to try a chocolatr croissant....YUM! Highly recommend this cafe.

99-uIIz1Y94ondlPTLGqwQ.text: We walked in, asked if they were serving food and were told the kitchen was closing but they could squeeze us in, and serve us lunch. We sat down, waited twenty minutes, finally, another waitress came by and told us kitchen was closed. We ordered tea and scones. The tea (not freshly brewed but mere teabags) came way before the scones (normally eaten together). Moments later the 2 tables near us ordered sandwiches and were served food. Will not ever come here again.

552uDZOdMpJcCp5anjLLtg.text: Tasty food and a cozy ambiance. Staff always had smiles on and approachable.  The meals we enjoyed were the English Breakfast and the Chicken Baguette with chips.

TY0tmG7owxaz4TgCglOT3Q.text: English breakfast teawas nice. Traditional english breakfast was a lot  for me, but the taste was good. I liked the scone, it was warm enough to enjoy it with breakfast, but it wasnt baked enough in the middle, it tasted little bit bitter. I hope it was a mistake. I liked the stuffed cream and jam.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

qdl1SpiKbUvqP2K0ttSRog.text: I generally avoid restaurants near large tourist attractions as they are generally, more bark than bite. But this place really is all the other reviewers say it is. Fresh, simple food, warm atmosphere and great, friendly staff. (Though to be fair Britons in general are hospitable and warm). Great soup and sandwich after watching the changing of the guard at Buckingham Palace in the cold!!!

qK_AaK_jaF2JeO6jHC-GeA.text: Came here with my wife and ordered a full English breakfast (£7.50) and Cream for Two (£8.75; a teapot of English breakfast tea and two scones with clotted cream and jam) - perfect for a Sunday morning and a good size for the two of us. The mushrooms in the English breakfast are especially good, and the scones were still warm when they arrived. The clotted cream wasn't my thing (then again, I don't like cream in general...) but the jam was good and my wife enjoyed it all. The decor is charming - the tables and chairs are mismatched, and there's a teapot tree in the corner. You get the impression of being in someone's living room.All of the teapots, tea cups, saucers, etc. are for sale (£14 for a small teapot and £19 for a large; tea cup, saucer, and dessert plate set for £12). They also sell homemade jams and marmalade (£2.50 each or £6 for 3) and herbal tea from the London Tea Company (£3.95 for the box).

O08eP4qgtJtZEZivNBNgkg.text: Quaint, quiet and sweet. Cream two for two with their biscuits was lovely.  off the beaten path and near the Palace. Sweet little seemingly owner run location.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Exterior
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Their piano music
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

i8DmcYH9rIJ1jfESpHx4GA.text: Quaint little cafe across the street from Buckingham Palace. As our first meal in the U.K. we didn't know what to expect, but were very pleased with what we ordered. I got the Roasted Vegetable omelette, and my friend got the Mediterranean scrambled eggs and yoghurt. All were delicious and great portions for the price. Would suggest to anyone looking for a delicious breakfast near Buckingham Palace.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

x_W78GN0QuRE3LWPasp6eA.text: Best spot for an inexpensive English breakfast!  Excellent cappuccino.  Cute grandma's house type interior.

Xrlr9xZtqIwJU7DITPw_pw.text: Cute tea room just off the beaten pass. Great place to go after visiting the Queen's Gallery. *** about the service***From the moment we walked in the blonde lady behind the calendar was very rude. She acted like she was offended we had the audacity to eat in their shop. She told us they were no longer serving food (we arrived at 4:30 and they closed at 6p). We clarified and she told us they were only serving cakes. We chose a cozy table in the back and had to wait quite 30 minutes to order although another party came in and was served by her in a prompt manor. Eventually we went up to the counter and politely asked if we could put in an order and she literally rolled her eyes at us. At this point we were ready to go somewhere else. The kind gentleman (Dan) behind the counter, who had only been working there 3 weeks, jumped in and said he would take our order. We ordered tea and scones. Another party walked in and ordered afternoon tea which included sandwiches when we were told we could only order cakes and that the kitchen was closed. Curious.  Our waiter was the saving grace that made us stay.

tIcz8MK3U69wZupyuJosHQ.text: My mother and I visited a few weeks ago while staying in London at the Rubens at the Palace across the street.  We had afternoon tea and the scones were warm with delicious clotted cream and jam. We loved it so much, we returned the next morning and would have returned a third time if we had the time.  The breakfasts were delicious as well.  The employees were very kind, friendly, and helpful.  What is unique about this cafe is that you can buy any teacup, teapot, etc.  I was able to buy a sugar bowl I was fond of to bring home to the USA as a souvenir.  We will definitely be back someday.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

6Lj78-H0auz0SAFjobNyhw.text: This is perfect for an afternoon pit stop. We have some fabulous chamomile tea for two with honey. We also got a hot chocolate and soup and sandwich. It really made us feel like we were getting a traditional experience. Would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Teapot tree
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

O64TpYQqZOpOXTaYkj1YhA.text: Traditional quaint, cozy and beautiful tea room. The family owners are very attentive and welcoming. We  came for breakfast, it was great! Then we returned for afternoon tea and we loved it also!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

-PWcSz8z3JbPQhHdoZ8YRw.text: Aww I love this little spot. We had a Groupon for afternoon tea. The selection was decent. I liked that we were able to sit outside and enjoy our tea, although the curb is super small and you're basically staring into the souls of those driving past, which includes massive buses lol. I purchased a few jams, which had edible glitter. SOLD! I loved 2 out of the 3 jams. The grapefruit one was too bitter for me. Pricing was good as well as service.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. The amazing glitter jams

jZfnFP6zRThO5AA47B0M6g.text: Very quaint little spot for afternoon tea! Extremely cozy and well-priced for good food/tea

YejW5EGlbeQEEUPHaPSQ4w.text: Such a cute place! My porridge and scones with clotted cream hit the spot. Very fairly priced and great service. Loved the vanilla chai tea too.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. A great breakfast of porridge, scone with clotted cream, and vanilla chai tea

P0UN3luBah6Q5Gw62HY5AQ.text: We arrived to a Buckingham palace tour early and decided to pop in this place for a quick snack. We had chai tea and some sandwiches. The chai tastes mostly like milk but the sandwiches were delicious. We ordered chicken bacon sandwich and tomato basil sat. Both were fresh and flavorful. I want to try their afternoon tea next time. The decor of the inside is very vintage and cute. They also sell homemade jams in those little jars.

wmOoLkILxGOAegmBNP-Log.text: Such an adorable and cute cafe. Typically British with fast service and delicious food. Definitely recommend!

b03M2zO3vUt32c5hA-zCVA.text: Cute atmosphere. Friendly people. Food bland and tasteless. I had Jacket Potatoes with Avocado and Feta. Chunks of each on a split baked potato. Daughter had a baguette with tomato and mozzarella. Also bland. Scone was decent. Clotted cream acceptable.

xvoNQGO4Aep2z8zsFZkqRw.text: Amazing little place next to the Buckingham palace. Great food for the amount of money you pay. The serving time is a bit slow but it's because you can taste and smell the freshly made food right off the bat. Overall a great place with an amazing atmosphere. I look forward to coming back to try more of their menu.Highly recommended: Their hot chocolate and sausage are amazing. I ordered the English breakfast and my girlfriend ordered their omelette, we were both very satisfied. The service is also nice and quick even on a full house.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Great quote complementing the great atmosphere.

Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast on the bottom, ham and cheese omelette on the top left, and scone on the top right. All three were great choices!
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate: Delicious on a snowy day!

K23JIV54X04megofJ_XQNg.text: Traditional english breakfast served fast the place is cozy and the service excellent.  Food eas really tasty.  I had the baked beans and oh Lord the taste was just like in the us. Price was very reasonable and tbe scones were very good. No doubt about that i will be back to eat next week

TT5lMFm597s6VmHVW_KynA.text: This place has a nice atmosphere and friendly staff but I think we just did not come for the right meal. I'm sure it is a great spot for afternoon tea but our lunch left a lot to be desired. It took about 45 minutes to get our food and it looked like it was just the girls up front who actually made it. When we got it, the sandwiches weren't very good and they weren't cheap either. The folks next to us got the tea special and it looked a lot better than our meals. Definitely stick with that

SNKZKrvwY9cQ3Dhy8RHEjw.text: Got the traditional English breakfast and tea. Was an interesting mix of food and the service was great. Price was reasonable considering the touristy area.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Tradition English breakfast

681GU8DqbgOR2l-DDn9D8w.text: Just around the corner from the Grosvenor Hotel you will find a wonderful tea shop. It's is very nicely decorated and offers a nice traditional English breakfast. The price is more then fair and we found the service was spot on.

4nm8ZNCjS60lrK3A3cVPfQ.text: Stay away. Was waiting for my sandwich and drink for 45 minutes and nothing. Walked outside none of these servers had a clue what happened to my order.

1oUPwusS9C0cOxMhoKpT_w.text: Each time my wife and I have been to London, this has been our go to spot for breakfast and cup of tea to go. Always a friendly staff and great service. My company's UK office is about a 5 minute walk and if I worked across the pond, I'd be here every morning.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

IpjdaGwRBUpbItyDBaQrYw.text: Woah THIS PLACE IS SO SCRUMPTIOUS! I had the full English breakfast and ate it all. So hungry and left SO happy wow. Come hereAlso had the tea for two and the tea and scone was amazing.Come hereCome hereYou will think it's adorable

z04KGZ7j71epdUeFgU6nSg.text: This place was the cutest little spot!! My mom and I were looking for a quaint spot to have breakfast and tea and this place did not disappoint. Located fairly close to Buckingham palace, this place is full of charm. We ordered omelettes which looked like pizzas but were fantastic along with cream for two, which came with a pot of tea and scones with jam and clotted cream. The waitress was very kind and perfectly attentive for being what seemed like the only person working. I would definitely go back on my next trip to London!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

_QtwxpKF639QBW7_QQqdXA.text: Friendly staff, food is good for the price. The interior is cool!I ordered full English breakfast, pot of breakfast tea and a carrot cake.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Interior, quite cozy
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast, pot of breakfast tea and carrot cake. All under 20
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Mirror on the wall

I_Wlq3GeAXOw4JM3CB7G4Q.text: This place was very cozy with great service and prices right near Buckingham Palace. It was the perfect spot to have our first afternoon tea in London.  We each had tea and scones with clotted cream which were very good. If you want to experience tea time this is a great place to go without the formality and dress requirements of high tea.

Rog_Nic6EepE0iewtbcMVg.text: Absolutely Fantastic!! Loved the hazelnut latte and the red onion soup of the day was perfection with the ham and cheese baguette! Service was great and we were seated right away. They apologized for a wait on the food (20-25 minutes) because they were busy, but in all honestly that is very usual for places in the states to get the food out. Our waitress was lovely and very talkative, which was nice. I would recommend going here for Brunch! It's such a cute place!!

_NVQyohyDc7biU0gFu8Geg.text: I got my tea after 20+ min, then my pastries and sandwiches came 30+ min after the tea. That just defeat the purpose of having to order the afternoon tea set. The food wasn't good and it's so not worth the price. I had to constantly hunt the waiter down if I needed something; he wasn't attentive. He just care to congregate with co workers at the register. Then I had to go to the register to pay.

N-daDKH74_zf7I4YDDBMkg.text: Beautiful atmosphere..  We just wanted to try the afternoon tea in London  and it was a different experience.  They present a variety of sandwiches,  scones,  cakes with a spectacular presentation.  You really enjoy the experience more than the food itself...  Me and my wife are  tea lovers and we felt we found the right place here for afternoon tea.

8VAUZ7zK3qevvIah6Lfslw.text: What a delightful little cafe!Way more food than anticipated- making it a great value!  This little gem had excellent food, sandwiches and chips, great tea and a scone to die for!!!  And the service was so very nice and sweet. If you're going anywhere near Victoria station, or to Hamilton or wherever...be sure and visit this treat!

JvNrs5SIzDEvpIdEaj1fxQ.text: My first experience with Afternoon Tea, and it was perfect. I'd researched other places with Afternoon Tea, and this was definitely one of the least expensive. It was around £25 for an Afternoon Tea for Two - and they let us switch my husband's tea for coffee. We arrived right after watching the Changing of the Guard at Buckingham Palace, on a Monday. It's a tiny place, but we were able to get a seat right away. The scones are the best I have ever had. Not like the scones I get in America or at Starbucks. These were small and moist and so tasty. With clotted cream and a little jam. Ugh. I had to really strain to not steal my husband's share. It came with cute little sandwiches - a ham and cheese, a tuna and corn, and a cucumber and cream cheese. Plus some bits of different cakes (banana, and a chocolate/banana, and lemon). Also a muffin (possibly some kind of ginger/spice flavour). It was such a lovely little meal. My favorite of all during our week in London. Highly highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon Tea for Two. Traveling Pug for scale.

ra9fbIVDKVHzb3eESupJAQ.text: Very nice shop with lovey girls, great location right across the street from the palace sadly the food was poor quality and did not taste fresh

noaB_PScgH-WKgr8uZ4u1g.text: Nice little place. They have ac on the back so that was nice on a warm day. Limited selection of teas but all the popular ones. Not outrageously priced but the selection of food was limited too.My expectations were higher I guess. Over all ok but there are better tea houses on the neighborhood.

X59BKg42Lpq1rCAr5F2oWg.text: Best experience for a traditional English breakfast in the heart of London. We stayed near the palace at The Ruebens and it was a short walk in the rain. Service was superb and the food and tea were spot on!Cheers!

Oi4R9Me1qnW2hxuBSheBXw.text: This is definitely a neat little hole in the wall near the Victoria station. It had a nice little English style ambiance good for small groups or a date. I ordered the granola with Greek yogurt and a ham and cheese croissant and an English green tea. The granola and the tea were fantastic! I really enjoyed it and it tasted pretty fresh. I would say the ham and cheese croissant was average but it's not a French cafe :p.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. The menu
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. English green tea.
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

4sEQ_JZzxgYNsnzG26DGSg.text: This place was amazing. The decor and atmosphere is super cute and just what I'd hope I'd find for a traditional English tea. The tea pot and cups were awesome. The sandwiches, scones and cakes were absolutely delicious. The scone was nice and warm. The 3 different sandwiches were all very tasty and the cakes were delicious as well. The macaroons were great! We loved everything about this traditional tea. My boyfriend also ordered the cheese and ham croissant and it was warm but crispy. Everything was delicious and filling and the atmosphere made it that much better. The staff was very friendly as well. This is somewhere you have to go when visiting London!

CPT2TZr8a7B-SChrymdawQ.text: I had the traditional English breakfast which was deeeeelicious!! A cosy, quaint cafe with a warm ambience.  Enjoy my food while Bing Crosby croons in the background? I meaaan?! YES PuHLeaaaase!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

_WleIRmARCBj9DdYXbwYrw.text: As a visitor, it is the first breakfast that I ever tried in London. The food is REALLY GOOD (mushrooms in the English breakfast, smoked salmon and Earl Grey Tea are my favorites!) and the environment is lovely.Come here : ) it is definitely worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

lp6SQo6_SiC5K757O5mpfw.text: Cute cafe restaurant located near Buckingham Palace. My bf and I came here for brunch, but they also offer afternoon tea. I wanted to try a full English breakfast while we were in London, so we ordered that and a scone (shown on their dessert menu, not food menu). The full English was a decent portion for one person, and tasted fine. I really enjoyed my scone, which came still warm, and with jam and clotted cream. If I had more time in London, I would probably come back to try their afternoon tea, or to just get more scones! NOTE: 50% off a hot drink when you check-in on Yelp!

uGaD90vUOMGyR1xL_vZ9eQ.text: I'm a student studying abroad and this was my first afternoon tea experience. And suffice to say, it was amazing! If you want an elegant, affordable (£13 p/p), and delicious. Afternoon this is the place to go. Plus, it a ridiculously close for those near Buckingham Palace.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

6GNfYLpDNCbSlmSOHl2Oeg.text: Wanted traditional English breakfast and was super pleased with the meal and the restaurant. The interior is very cute and the service was great.we got a lot of English hot tea to go with our breakfast. Fyi...breakfast end at 12pm and their pretty strict about it so get there before 12 if you want breakfast food.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Traditional English breakfast.

OD9-_LERgZLsMjjGlwE1Ag.text: Food was decent. Service was a bit slow but understandable since there was only one worker in the early morning. Coffee was really good. We ordered the mocha and cappuccino which were both really tasty.

yUNATtYCgVsvzJxQ_v89xw.text: Really enjoyed our breakfast here. Ordered traditional english breakfast with tea, the meat and egg and tea all were cooked just right. Close to buckingham palace, 8min walk over after a full breakfast to view the change of guards.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. I think its the menu #1, full english breakfast combo.
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Tea pot display decor
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. Elegant tea china. Makes a good tea even more enjoyable.

dwORajgLapf_GWDGiXdVRg.text: Hot soup and cheesy grilled sandwich for only £5.  Beautiful and cozy decorated. Glad to be here even travel in solo

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

z9T3wGHOuOVeLMrpIpbGcA.text: A wonderful English Tea for two. Top notch. Staff was friendly, professional, and attentive. I would 110% recommend.

F0dhQzLfyVtS70GwkIf9nA.text: We came in at 2:30 on a Friday for afternoon tea and had the worst experience ever. Our table was messy with crumbs from the previous guests. There were no napkins, sugar or silverware. We ordered tea for two and they never even brought us the tea. The sandwiches were bland and didn't even have the crusts cut off. The avocado salad was terrible as well. The avocados were hard and sour tasting. Despite it being in the middle of avocado season. They were in the middle of renovation but even that does not excuse this poor service and bad food. We were told there was no manager on duty.  when we went to pay We saw the staff reheating someone's soup because it was served cold, but they left her sandwich on the dirty tray tables. Beware. I don't like to write a negative review, but it ruined our first ever London tea experience.

_IhDp7EkQig2hKVt6D6NjA.text: Anyone traveling to London and wants a English experience should come here! The vibe and decor is so cute! My husband and I wanted English tea so we went here for breakfast. He ordered the "traditional English breakfast." It was a lot of food! I had a taste of the sausage yummy! I ordered the smoked salmon and loved it! Came with two pieces of toast, avocado and eggs. The eggs were awesome cooked perfectly! We came in early (about 7:15am) so it was empty but did see some signed for reserved tables so worth a call if you plan to do afternoon tea.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

HYAOabrh0m5tzKPIE3u60w.text: A nice little place to go for afternoon tea and desserts. There's seating in three sections, the back, the front, and outside front patio. The place was hot inside so we sat in the front near the door. Some tables were really sticky as the varnish was old. They need to fix that. The young girls serving us were friendly. We chose the English breakfast tea and they set us up with a pot with two tea bags in it.  For dessert they provided a three tiered tray consisting of Sandwiches - cream cheese/cucumber, tuna, hamCakes: Chocolate cake, carrot cake, vanilla cakeScones: with butter and jam. What a nice time we had, we will definitely be back. The location is right near Buckingham Palace.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

hPW1p1YYzqNoPOakKfOJLQ.text: Absolutely adorable place.One of my favorite stops in London. Unfortunately, I didn't make it early enough for their English Breakfast, but their scones & clotted cream were absolutely to die for.I also had a veggie sandwich that was very tasty. This is right up the road from Buckingham Palace so if you're in the area, you should really come here for a try. I'm knocking one star off because of the restroom downstairs which is not up to par. I've been reading in the latest reviews that they're doing a renovation. I hope they are fixing it up down there. Such a cute spot deserves nice restrooms.

BFrSkY6hzvOwVKImh7Dcsg.text: I absolutely love this place! It was mine and my husbands first time in London and "tea time" was on the top of my list. I found this place on yelp and decided to try it out. I had high expectations and I was not disappointed. We ordered the afternoon tea for two with the sandwiches and cakes. Everything was so cute. The decor, the China and the sandwiches were super good! I'm sad we don't have anything like this where we are from. Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

zPQGWnbEngmylla3HQhcyQ.text: This is by far my favorite place for tea. It is very reasonably priced and the staff here is so friendly and welcoming! My friend and I always split the cream tea for two and are impressed with the high quality tea choices and how delicious the scones are! we tried several places in the uk but these scones were our favorite! we actually came here 3 times during our stay and I have gone back several more times now on other trips. I highly recommend this place!

uuiFC7LQ0yUWO3TyFMprUQ.text: We wanted to try a traditional english breakfast and this place located near our hotel offered it. It came with beans, a toast, mushrooms, 2 eggs, tomato,  2 sausages and ham for 8.50 pounds. I also took a caramel latte. They all tasted pretty good and aren't pricey. The place seems old but it's quite cute and nicely decorated. The staff is nice and welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

gQlx1HprG6IJjtu2vYTYUA.text: This might have been the highlight of my London trip! It was a quaint cafe that is quintessentially England. The service was great, atmosphere was relaxing and cozy and it's location is just down the street from Buckingham palace. We went around 10AM and was seated quickly, as we left around 11AM more of the tables started to fill. So I would plan to get there earlier! If the weather is nice there was also outdoor seating. This is a must, go-go-go! Can't wait to go back already.

P6iXuMp94zpMLnsZKBAd-w.text: Decorated with florals and tea kettles. Served with mismatched tea sets. Good experience, great location for tourism.

JkqpSYvLedLKXOz-NHyFhw.text: Nice little spot located between Victoria Station and Buckingham Palace. We stopped in hear for breakfast. Staff was lovely and service was prompt. The food ok - nothing special but no real issues either. Bathroom was in basement so stairs were necessary.

OfU7mbjIGPLhuAT3ClRtaw.text: If my wife were rating this place for the interior, she would give it a 5......but to be honest, I didn't think this place was all that great. It was okay, but not anything special. I had the traditional English breakfast which was good. Really liked the mushrooms, and the sausages were okay. Not a fan of pork & beans for breakfast, but when in Rome......I asked for some jam for the bread, and it tasted very good. Americans must be looking at these reviews, because that was all that was there.

apBMTv7leyfg-uEndWmyAQ.text: It was the first meal directly after a red-eye flight so I may be nitpicking. We had the tea for two which came with our own pot of tea, one scone each and a clotted cream with jam. I was not impressed with the scones. The density felt more like a biscuit than a scone. The clotted cream didn't have any taste. However, the jam was great and the tea was what we needed. Service was okay--it was a bit slow with a steady traffic of customers.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

F-g4-GYG4SQt0MwB5hoW5Q.text: Not bad at all.  Great location, close to the Whitehall area.  Afterwards,  we walked to the Winston Curchill museum (1/2 mile). We went there for the traditional English Breakfast and we weren't disappointed.  We did have to ask for our scones at least three times but in retrospect,  I think that they were being baked.  We will definitely be back the next time we're in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

ifl5AUIN_KFiV6S8pAgJAg.text: This was a little cute, very English, breakfast/brunch place near the Buckingham Palace. I wanted to try English styled breakfast for myself and saw that "The English Rose" for short had really great reviews. I was not impressed, but maybe it's just because I didn't like the breakfast?? Not that it didn't taste good because I'm sure it does to others. For what it was.. I think it costed about $15 USD for breakfast per person.. which is a lot for what I had. :( As an American I don't like English food much... so I really just thought it was average.The food also took a little while to get to us, but the staff was very nice.

IqBRIoxWkNSxiRIviR91FA.text: Great location right near Buckingham Palace. The interior is cozy and decorated very lovely! The food was good, and service was friendly. As a first time London visitor, it felt very "English"

sBDkfA2kxsBomJlewW68_Q.text: My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our time here at the English Rose Cafe, this place is nicely located near the Buckingham Palace and near the tourist spots. Despite the location, I was think that this place would be expensive but it was not. For two people for an afternoon tea we spent only $17 each with a proseco, I like that it wasn't TOO overwhelming with pastries and sweets because let's be real.. who the heck can stomachs all that. We had some tuna sandwiches, the scones were amazing, cucumber cream cheese sandwiches (not so good), and their mini cakes (wasn't our favorite).

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

3-URnuk2OvzCFWRtI5TlVg.text: Quick cup of tea and a biscuit to recharge your day.Our Order:  CREAM TEA FOR TWO- 2 warm scones with clotted cream and jam, and a big pot of tea for two.Environment: quaint little tea ship near Buckingham Palace. Nice bathrooms and free WiFi (great for travelers who want to upload photos after their Buckingham Palace trip).Verdict: scones were delicious especially with the clotted cream and jam, but he tea was underwhelming. It was not one pot, it was two little pots of hot water and mugs with tea bags. For a team shop, I'd expect some loose leaf tea in a pot already steeping. Staff was super friendly, but a tea shop should do tea right, hence the three stars.Tips: go during no-peak hours.Next Time: probably try the afternoon tea for two and try the finger foods - it looks very appetizing when others around us ordered.

snyvKLnQTAAbi0mmDg1z1w.text: The English breakfast was good. I'm usually not a fan of mushrooms but theirs tasted great! One thing I notice was that the utensils were not the cleanest...

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

UABhLrULgFJ7UqYGyXxg8Q.text: This is a great tourist spot especially since it's close to Buckingham Palace. The service was good and their afternoon tea was even better. If you're looking for a cheaper afternoon tea option I definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

8BA3ybnHwHqZCCMkSuKuAA.text: This cafe has earned a spot in my list of top five favorite breakfast places. We chose this place because it was near Buckingham Palace, not expecting anything memorable, and left with a promise to come back. For breakfast, we order smoked salmon+eggs+toast, bacon+eggs+toast, a full English breakfast, cream tea and scones, and coffee. Every single item was delicious. Granted, it's pretty hard to mess up smoked salmon and eggs, but the bacon was thick and flavorful (not just salty), the scones were warm and fluffy, and the tea and coffee were so smooth. The portions were generous enough that we were able to last past lunch time before we were hungry enough for another meal. The service was wonderful. We were greeted with smiles and our server was extremely friendly and welcoming. The restaurant is sweetly decorated with cute, feminine touches everywhere. Definitely an insta-worthy spot. They say breakfast is the most important meal and this definitely set us off on the right foot for a 10 mile day of exploring London. Note that this review was solely about our first visit. We tried coming back right before our flight and it turned out that the chef just didn't show up that day (?!) and the replacement would be arriving after we needed to leave. The staff gave us free tea and coffee as an apology which was super nice of them. I'd still highly recommend The English Rose Café based on our first experience!

q-ei0ly73Rf6xEV2Nwdijw.text: Went here for tea yesterday and it did not disappoint. The scones were absolutely incredible, the jam was so perfect. The finger sandwiches were a little bigger than expected, really more the size of regular sandwiches and the toppings were just okay (tuna salad, ham and cheese, cheese and onion), but they were tasty. The sweets were fabulous though! The Victoria sponge was amazing, the chocolate muffin was good, and the banana bread was INCREDIBLE. Very satisfied with my afternoon tea

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

hOIzG2je9wH6Fyp2Qd0yEw.text: This place is tucked away in a corner in a fairly tourist area.  We went there for lunch and got the soup and toastie, both soups of the day were delicious and tasted really fresh! The price was very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food.  We went again for afternoon tea. The waitress was very nice and accommodated us even though the kitchen was closed.  The tea was delicious, and they were able to make all vegetarian sandwiches for me.  The chocolate cake,  macaroons, and sconces were delicious! The best was the gingerbread muffin - probably the best muffin I've ever had.  Definitely  give this place a try if you're in the area,  the staff is very nice and the food is delicious  (and very  reasonably priced)

0GacMwhZpQyyGgF8QdyHdQ.text: Loved it! Found Cafe Bella Maria on Yelp after arriving at our hotel. Went in for a quick bite. Food was delicious and the staff was friendly. Very helpful when we asked about directions. Was the first stop in London on vacation from the U.S. and would definitely recommend!

QkO0GiRWSogz2urPdofRJg.text: best scone i've ever had! we used a groupon and everything was amazing. Especially the scone.

2q7BM9zjtgTRIzcYdeYyxQ.text: Solid panninis, the Parma ham with rocket is nice. Its also a great lilttle spot for tea and sweets.

ebHKoKB_C55f_6KrsSL4PA.text: Stopped here just after arriving in London and it was such a nice location and atmosphere- the tables are quaint and it is adorably decorated. We ended up going twice during our time in London and got a Parma panini, which was great and hot, and the second time, a toastie and soup. The soup was sweet potato and delicious! Also, we got tea for two that afternoon and the English breakfast tea was hot and scones with curdled cream and jam were lovely.

4a9DgXUPrTipxi0vvgKq4Q.text: Why buy an ad on this app with wrong opening hours ? Walked with a heavy luggage there, find it closed.

NDNVKbtzValEbi79Xg3NFg.text: Adorable place, great atmosphere, cute food- however, there was one waitress for all of 15 tables. We waited 20 minutes for our drink order, and 30+ minutes for our food. Halfway through our meal, we were asked to move to a smaller table to accommodate a larger group. Cute place, but I would recommend going at a non busy  time!

QVdiZi3y7GjzdssMFlfIAg.text: I ordered the panini with goat's cheese, onions and sweet peppers and OMG it was sooooo delicious!  I would definintely go back here again... my brother and I went here after a horrible time at Port A Mangia (he ate, but I refused to eat where the service was just rude and rushed)...Bella Maria was very chill, relaxed and the ladies behind the counter were sweet.  The panini was so large for only 5 pounds I had enough to eat after the tours and all the walking when I get hungry again... thank you for being so close to the Palace and being friendly and delicious to boot... the way a restaurant should be!

8XXNHy1T-XhcSQ8lrzNYsg.text: Lovely cafe with nice food and friendly waitresses.  Remember to go to their restroom.  I like the decorations:)

0dlwaiP30CaCdxJk7OQqMg.text: Great quiet and quaint hole in the wall tea shop. We went for afternoon tea and it was truly lovely. Our cream tea was accompanied by scones, finger sandwiches, and cakes! Cautious with big groups since the seating area is a bit on the smaller side.

eeDcIoU_cw5AXXoGsfLg0Q.text: Sweet little spot with the fanciest tea cups! They serve breakfast in here and even though they don't have a large variety on the menu, what they offer tastes actually great. I've become a fan of their fruit skewers - it's really good. My second choice for sure would be lemon drizzle cake combined with warm coffee yaaas.The only think I could dislike is the location, as it is pretty far from my area, but I'll be back here sometime.

9EfjJS2eOx4MKpIjaiVvLA.text: My wife and I stopped here on the first full day of our honeymoon. I had the full English breakfast, my wife had an omelette, and we split a pot of tea. All of it was delicious. A meal or tea at this quiet, cozy spot is a great way to start the day. I highly recommend the cafe to locals and tourists alike.

dKwg3_Mrku_P_XGtvWYHiw.text: Super cute hidden gem in the heart of the city! They have a great high tea for 2 for £20. Lots of little sandwiches, one scone per person (including cream and jam), and so many desserts on the top tray! It's my go-to tea place now.

sJeJ53Eh2K1SRGBlN67K8A.text: This place is such a gem, not even that hidden, but UNEXPECTED near Victoria, Buckhingham and around such a touristy area. The cafe itself doesn't feel touristy AT ALL -- it's super cute and quaint, friendly staff, and really yummy homemade treats! It's near my work, so I've come here a few times for meetings. I love that all the tables and chairs are unique -- adds to that homey feeling. Good selection of hot (and not) drinks and baked goods and treats. They have a loyalty card, where the 6th hot drink is free, so I've been using that.

8lvD0RhpkeR-peMx2hPohQ.text: cozy environment, well decorated and nice service. Cute teapot and cups, I really like it. Though the food is just alright, especially the scrambled eggs is too wet and salmon is not that good.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. scrambled eggs with salmon toast and earl grey tea
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom. nice and cute environment

8r_j3D9hW3uA803WXywGXw.text: When traveling it can be difficult to find simple, healthy, wholesome, and satisfying food at a reasonable price.  This was all that, plus a nice, relatively quiet atmosphere to recoup after walking around town.

WXSHc4MsRGzR9Edhj6qC9A.text: Great place for traditional afternoon tea! Very tasty with lovely staff, unique look and reasonable price!

dAXSpDM7Rs7VizYcTUsN5Q.text: Awesome little cafe right near tourist areas in LondonI went here for brunch during my brief 3 day visit to London. Very convenient location and easy to miss this place. Definitely the best English breakfast I've had and the prices were very reasonable especially considering the area. Everyone in my group was impressed with this place. Very interesting decor in this place. It's almost as if we walked into an old lady's home. The unique feel contributed to the experience.I will definitely be back during my next trip to London.

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

UzXk55-Y2a9JAU6PCiv5bA.text: We had traditional English breakfast and a tea for 2, which turned out to be pretty amazing. The friendly atmosphere and the tasty food both soothed us in a chilly morning. We checked in on Yelp and thus used the 50% off coupon for hot tea. A good choice for travellers who want to save money and have a wonderful English breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

4G2iTgcz8Kj080zmYWK1jg.text: Came here for lunch on a Sunday morning and was excited based on the good reviews. Our coffees came in ten minutes, but the service went COMPLETELY down hill after that. We watched our server place the wrong order at different tables, and after 40+ mins of waiting, our 2 English breakfast plates were still nowhere to be seen. We would've liked to order more coffee/tea during the wait but our server was nowhere. I finally went to the front counter to pay for our drinks and leave close to the 1 HOUR mark....and saw our food was just sitting behind the counter. The cashier was very sweet and apologized, saying that our food was right here if we cared to stay and eat. Fine. We sat back down at our table for ANOTHER ten mins before served. The only reason this got 1 more star was because the cashier was very professional, and the sausages/mushrooms were good.

x0HBMwucLoXKyd3eaN5V5A.text: Cute little cafe very close to Buckingham Palace. I had the carrot cake and teas. The carrot cake was delicious and I really enjoyed the side of cream that came with the cake.Free wifi which is nice and reasonable prices.

hl8f-M7yiTF7eeOc5xTdJQ.text: Absolutely amazing food and great service, fantastic decor and environment, A must try if in London!

tPmqyxLWttU-u6fja55dMQ.text: The ambience was very lovely,  but I would not recommend this place for a meal. My sister and I were both very disappointed with our lunches, but at least the price for our disappointing lunch was very cheap.  The servers were very nice,  but it took 30 minutes for our food to come out and it was cold (including both soups).

q6SzH_JpBU4l8eFxOZQDjA.text: Lunch after visiting Buckingham Palace, well you know the OUTSIDE of the palace, not actually visiting per se, could not have been more lovely. Small and cozy, with delicious sandwiches and soup. Friendly, unhurried service made me wish we could stay longer. Would go back the next time we're calling on the Queen.

FDCBeW7Bew7y3pnxKTMfaA.text: I am originally from Melbourne Australia, living in Los Angeles California and am currently traveling in the UK. As you can imagine, life as a traveler can be very stressful. I had the craziest morning this morning and was looking for an internet cafe to print out a script. It seemed like my map was leading me to an internet cafe that does not exist. Instead, I ended up at this nice little cafe. I had asked the ladies who were working there if I had come to the right location. They told me that I came to the wrong place and they do not know where the place I am looking for is located, and then offered me to use their internet. I told them I needed to print something and they said they could help me print it. I ordered a soda from them as I did not have time to order any of their cakes, as delicious as they looked. If you are ever in London and want a nice place to chill over a coffee or cake, be sure to give this place a visit! Both the young ladies working there are extremely nice and helpful. Really made my morning a lot less stressful! Thank you!

DXCQUkVWHRPraM-MkotMCw.text: loved there! had a cup of cappuccino with Italiano sandwich(you can choose between normal sandwich style and wrap which was cool).atmosphere is warm & place itself is decorated in very lovely british way :)dishes & drinks were served in vintage plates & cups. Indeed defining what 'lovely' should be like!

photos.caption: Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The English Rose Cafe and Tea Shop - London, United Kingdom

9zRLHf6sBMvN2vVZdq1WKw.text: Extremely cozy spot. As a college student traveling, it's affordable and nice. There's also free wifi! We were seated instantly and didn't have to wait too long after ordering. My friend and I got the tea and scones for two deal and it was £5.50 which really isn't too bad. The teapot fills the teacup up to six times total. We're very happy with our experience! :) It's about a five minute walk from Buckingham Palace and close to the rest of the tourist areas.

U4e_xb64rpj0kAOTRvrNrw.text: In London I fell in love. She was a beautiful lady that Maria. A Bella Maria. This cafe was an amazing find... I don't love tea but I do love coffee. So my friends and I had "coffee time" at this darling little cafe, not once, but twice. And it would have been thrice had we stayed in London a little while longer. My first experience at Bella Maria was during off-peak hours, which meant good service. My second experience was during lunch and boy was it busy! Finding a seat was difficult, there weren't any available inside but they had two tables free outside. I had the cappuccino here twice and the first time it blew my mind but the second time it was quite horrid. I guess it was because they were so busy... or at least that's what I will keep saying to myself. I also had one of their panini's and it was spectacularly delicious. I mean, I would probably go back to London just for that panini. It seems like they were slammed during lunch and they couldn't handle the heat [no pun intended]. I think they also forget orders... like they did my cappuccino that second time. You may ask then, why are you still giving that place 5 stars? Well, because it was the cutest darned place I ever saw. The decor was phenomenal, like a sweet country home. Books on a book shelf, mixed tea/coffee cups, flower pots on the tables, and a charming glass window. I mean, I would have moved in. Anyways, I guess you may call it puppy love but I just couldn't get enough of Bella Maria!
